column4: okay.... so you guys are probably going to be sick of a question like this... but I am completely new.  I went to the home page for Ubuntu, downloaded the .iso, burned it to disk, stuck it in the machine I am going to install it on... and got  "No init found. Try passing init=bootarg."  I have no clue what to do from there
how did you burn your cd?
checked the md5 sum after download?
So the disk I burned is useless?
your cd doesn't seem to be correct, so you had an error while burning or the download is corrupt, so first check your download and that is alright, check the burning process
if you have an usb stick available, just use its
I have none here.  I lost the one I had
here the md5sum tool http://www.md5summer.org/download.html and here you can find the correct value for your download
so your md5 hash is correct. hmm where there any errors during the cd creation
have you a recent pc or and oldone? found people having isues with old bios
use the one offered on the download page and try again
just realized that its a bit hidden under the show me button
